creator: jwoolley@apache.org
text:
As this is a PHP-related issue, please report it (if you haven't already) at 
bugs.php.net.  Thanks for using Apache!

creator: cekstein@cbre.com
text:
I'm sorry but Apache is crashing not PHP, by the way same code works with IIS 
4, it only crash Apache.

creator: jwoolley@apache.org
text:
It still goes to bugs.php.net, really.  :)  PHP has different modules for each 
server API that it supports ("SAPI" modules).  It's totally believable that 
there would be a bug in one and not another, especially since the Apache2 SAPI 
module is still in its infancy.  Post the bug on bugs.php.net and list it 
as "Apache2 related" in the category field.

creator: aaron@apache.org
text:
I just wanted to point out that the reporter is seeing this problem
on both Apache 1.3.24 and 2.0.36. This is more evidence that this
problem is in the mysql sapi module in PHP and *not* in Apache.

In any case, thanks for taking the time to file this bug report.
